attributes.title: Figure 4 In A New Kukri Snake (Colubridae: Oligodon) From Hua Hin District, And The First Record Of O. Deuvei From Thailand
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. Dorsal, left and ventral views of the head of the live paratype of Oligodon huahin sp. nov. (PSUZC 720), showing a presubocular scale on each side. Photographs by H. Larsen.

attributes.title: Figure 1 In Who Is The Red-Bearded Snake, Anyway? Clarifying The Taxonomic Status Of Chironius Pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824) (Serpentes: Colubridae)
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Illustration of one of the apparently lost syntypes of Chironius pyrrhopogon. Modified from Wied (1825 a).

attributes.title: Figure 1 In Who Is The Red-Bearded Snake, Anyway? Clarifying The Taxonomic Status Of Chironius Pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824) (Serpentes: Colubridae)
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Illustration of one of the apparently lost syntypes of Chironius pyrrhopogon. Modified from Wied (1825 a).

attributes.title: Figure 2 In Who Is The Red-Bearded Snake, Anyway? Clarifying The Taxonomic Status Of Chironius Pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824) (Serpentes: Colubridae)
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Direct records of Chironius exoletus (squares) and C. pyrrhopogon following institutional identifications attributed to specialists (white circles), and indirect records of C. pyrrhopogon recovered in the catalogues of the Instituto Butantan (black circles), the black star represents the type-locality of C. pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824). Specimens of Instituto Butantan were destroyed by fire on May 15 th of 2010.

attributes.title: Figure 2 In Who Is The Red-Bearded Snake, Anyway? Clarifying The Taxonomic Status Of Chironius Pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824) (Serpentes: Colubridae)
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Direct records of Chironius exoletus (squares) and C. pyrrhopogon following institutional identifications attributed to specialists (white circles), and indirect records of C. pyrrhopogon recovered in the catalogues of the Instituto Butantan (black circles), the black star represents the type-locality of C. pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824). Specimens of Instituto Butantan were destroyed by fire on May 15 th of 2010.

attributes.title: Figure 3 In Who Is The Red-Bearded Snake, Anyway? Clarifying The Taxonomic Status Of Chironius Pyrrhopogon (Wied, 1824) (Serpentes: Colubridae)
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. Frequency plots of number of supralabials (A) and infralabials (B) of specimens identified as Chironius pyrrhopogon and C. exoletus.
